<doc> Cascading style sheet (HSS)

== Description ==

The functions described in the page manages HOP cascade style sheets
(hss). See the documentation on 
,(<SPAN> 
    :class "href" 
    :onclick ~(notepad-select "doc-notepad" "doc-hss")
    "HSS") 
for a general presentation of HSS.

== Synopsis ==

=== server ===

  (hop-hss-type! string string)
  (hop-load-hss string)
  (hop-read-hss input-port)

== Examples ==
<example>hop-hss-type!, hop-load-hss, hop-read-hss</example>

== Server Definitions ==
<server>

=== ++(hop-hss-type! new old)++ ===
<function> hop-hss-type!

<arguments>
^  arguments       ^   type       ^  short description                ^
| new              |  string      | the new name for the CSS select.  |
| descriptor       |  string      | the original CSS selector.        |
</arguments>

This function installs an alias for the ++selector++.
</function>

=== ++(hop-load-hss path)++ ===
<function> hop-load-hss

<arguments>
^  arguments       ^   type       ^  short description                ^
| path             |  string      | the name of a HSS file.           |
</arguments>

Loads an HSS file in memory.
</function>

=== ++(hop-read-hss port)++ ===
<function> hop-read-hss

<arguments>
^  arguments       ^   type       ^  short description                ^
| port             |  input-port  | a port opened for input.          |
</arguments>

Reads a HSS expression from an input port.
</function>


</server>

== See also ==
<see-also>hop-load-hss, hop-read-hss, hop-hss-type!</see-also>

</doc>
